summary: This document is a Deutsche Bank alert regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting his status as a registered sex offender and detailing various legal issues he has faced, including multiple convictions related to sexual offenses and solicitation of minors. It also lists several addresses associated with Epstein and mentions his monitoring due to critical risk factors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a financier and a registered sex offender, with a history of convictions for soliciting prostitution and sexual offenses against minors.

events.title: Conviction for Soliciting Minors
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting a minor for prostitution and was sentenced to 18 months in jail.

events.title: Served Jail Time
events.description: Epstein served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation and registered as a sex offender.

events.title: Registered as a Sex Offender
events.description: Epstein appeared on the New York Sex Offenders site.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a registered sex offender since 2008.
He has faced multiple legal issues, including convictions for soliciting prostitution and sexual offenses against minors.
As of May 2013, Epstein had made 17 out-of-court settlements related to sexual abuse claims.
Epstein served 13 months in jail after pleading guilty to soliciting minors for prostitution.
The document indicates a critical risk priority alert for Epstein due to his criminal history.
